name: Cédric Brieussel
summary: With 30 years of extensive experience in the mechanical industry (including automotive and aeronautics) across various departments, I have good knowledge and skills related to the manufacturing of mechanical products. My approach is holistic, allowing me to understand the end-to-end processes seamlessly. My last experiences are related to Quality Control, but my expertises span a wide range of activities: Lean Manufacturing, Process Engineering, Supply Chain Management, Manufacturing. Throughout my career, I have demonstrated effective leadership by successfully managing teams. My management style is characterized by a focus on empowerment and involvement, where I prioritize the growth and engagement of my teammates in a collaborative and stable work environment,
notes: Good track and leadership but a bit short on Quality (12/15). Strong Process focus though. Busch Group is at 2B and 8000 FTEs. He is head of Vacuum Solutions which is main BU (sometimes used interchangeably in their own website). Other 2 BUs seem like acquisitions. 19 plants, present in 45 countries.

experience.title: Global Quality Manager
experience.description: Head of Quality for Busch Manufacturing Companies (Germany, Switzerland, Czechia, UK, USA, Korea, India, China). Supplier, internal and customer Quality. Global Process Owner et Process Expert for QM Module in SAP S/4 HANA. Norms and regulations expert.
experience.justification: As a Global Quality Manager overseeing multiple countries, this role aligns with the strategic responsibilities and impact of a Quality Director.

experience.title: SAP Project Manager
experience.description: Project Manager for the implementation of SAP S/4HANA - Move from Infor LN to SAP for all main modules. Management of a team of 10 Key-Users. Common project with the Busch German factory.
experience.justification: While not strictly a quality role, managing a major ERP implementation project requires senior-level expertise and impacts quality processes.

experience.title: Quality and Safety Manager
experience.description: Head of Quality and Safety for the Busch factory located in Switzerland (450 employees) - Management of 14 team members - Included Supplier Quality, Internal Quality, Customer Quality, Safety, Gauge calibration.
experience.justification: This role involves managing the quality department for a large factory, aligning with the responsibilities of a Quality Manager.

experience.title: ERP Project manager (Infor LN)
experience.description: Project Manager - Implementation of Infor LN (Legacy system: Baan 4) - Management of a team of 8 Key-Users - Management of external consultants.

experience.title: Production Manager
experience.description: Management of a autonomous workshop manufacturing vacuum systems - Included the Manufacturing processes (assembly, painting, testing, packaging) and the management of the Supply chain (procurement, warehousing, planning, dispatching) - Team of 20 employees.
experience.justification: While not a direct quality role, production management at this level involves significant quality oversight and aligns with mid-level supervisory responsibilities.

experience.title: Production Control Manager
experience.description: Management of the Production Control - Procurement, Planning, Warehousing, Bill of Materials. Management of 5 teamleaders (30 team members).
experience.justification: Managing production control involves quality aspects and aligns with mid-level supervisory responsibilities in a quality-adjacent field.

experience.title: Logistics Manager
experience.description: Supply Chain Management for the Heavy Truck plant (250 employees) - Procurement, Warehousing, Planning, Customer order management, Dispatching. Management of a team of 13 persons.
experience.justification: Supply chain management has significant quality implications and aligns with mid-level supervisory responsibilities.

experience.title: Production Manager
experience.description: Management of a APU (Autonomous Production Unit) - 50 workers, 5 production lines - Machining, Assembly, Stamping, Quenching.
experience.justification: Managing an Autonomous Production Unit involves quality oversight and aligns with mid-level supervisory responsibilities.

experience.title: Process Engineering Manager
experience.description: Design and implementation of Manufacturing processes and equipments. Machining of casting parts, quenching, stamping, assembly. Investment of new production lines and special automated machines.
experience.justification: Process engineering management strongly impacts product quality and aligns with senior professional responsibilities in quality-adjacent fields.

experience.title: Lean Expert - Process engineer
experience.description: Implementation of Lean methods (5S, SMED, TPM, Kan-Ban, One-Piece-Flow, ...) - Process engineer for one product line.
experience.justification: Implementing Lean methods and process engineering are closely related to quality improvement, aligning with mid-level professional responsibilities.

name: Cemal Yilmaz
summary: Ich bin Cemal Yilmaz, Head of Global Quality Management. Seit drei Jahren bin ich verantwortlich für das globale Qualitätsmanagement, Arbeitssicherheit und Umweltmanagement. Ich habe einen Diplom-Abschluss als Elektroingenieur FH, NDS in Qualitätsmanagement, und eine Ausbildung als Lean Experte. Mein Ziel ist es, die Kundenzufriedenheit und die Stimme des Kunden zu verbessern, indem ich die Produktqualität, die Prozessqualität und die Qualitätskultur kontinuierlich optimiere. Ich habe Erfahrung und bin Lead Auditor in der Nuklearen Qualitätssicherung nach ASME NQA-1, 10CFR50 App.B, 10CFR21 und bin sehr versiert mit den Anforderungen der ISO9001, ISO14001 und ISO45001. Ich wende Lean Six Sigma Methoden und Werkzeuge an, um die Ursachen von Fehlern zu analysieren und Qualitätsverbesserungsprojekte zu leiten. Ich arbeite eng mit internen und externen Partnern zusammen, um die Qualitätsstandards und die Kundenerwartungen zu erfüllen. Ich bin den operativen Tätigkeiten wie auch mit strategischem Qualitätsmanagement sehr vertraut.
notes: V-ZUG - Swiss, 600M revenue. Kitchen appliances so higher tier. Customer focus exp. Will have to ask if this is compensated by exp at Schneider. Schneider - WW might mean Water and Wastewater Gutor - Power supply systems

experience.title: Head of Global Quality Management
experience.description: Verantwortlich für das globale Qualitätsmanagement, Arbeitssicherheit und Umweltmanagement. Produktentstehungsprozess-Qualität, Feldfehler Analyse und Qualitätsverbesserungsprojekte in der Serie Entwicklung. Reduktion der Nonconformity Cost.

experience.title: Customer Satisfaction & Quality Director
experience.justification: The role of Customer Satisfaction & Quality Director suggests oversight of multiple quality functions and contribution to organizational planning, fitting the Senior Quality Manager category.

experience.title: Quality & Environmental Manager WW
experience.justification: As a worldwide Quality & Environmental Manager, this role involves managing quality operations and ensuring compliance across a significant scope, aligning with the Quality Manager category.

experience.title: Lean Manufacturing Manager
experience.description: ▪ Verantwortlich für die Optimierung der Produktion und des Materialflusses ▪ Zuständig für die Führung, Realisierung und Kosten des Schneider Production Systems (SPS) Projektes ▪ Einführung von Lean Tools wie Little Train, 5S und Optimierung des gesamten Produktionsprozesses
experience.justification: While focused on lean manufacturing, this role involves managing resources and implementing quality-related initiatives, similar to mid-level quality supervisory roles.

experience.title: Projektingenieur
experience.description: ▪ Projektierung von unterbrechungsfreien Stromversorgungs-Systemen (USV) ▪ Verantwortung für die Ausführung und das Controlling der internationalen Projekte ▪ Sicherstellung der terminlichen, qualitativen und finanziellen Projektziele ▪ Intensive Kontaktpflege zur internationalen Kundschaft und zu den Partnern
experience.justification: As a project engineer working on UPS systems, this role likely involved quality assurance aspects similar to mid-level quality professionals, though not exclusively focused on quality.

experience.title: Projekt Manager
experience.description: ▪ Projektrealisierung bei den Energieversorgungsunternehmen ▪ Projektierung von Zählerfernauslesesoftware und Energiedatenmanagement-Software ▪ Schulung und Abnahme des Projektes ▪ Spezifikationen für die Entwicklungsabteilung sowie Schnittstellendefinitionen ▪ Ansprechpartner für alle Kunden. ▪ Weitere Aufgabe ist der Vertrieb der Hardware, die Parametrierung und die kundenspezifische Anpassung der Geräte

name: Cuong C.
summary: I am a accomplished professional with 30 years of experience in industries ranging from chemistry, construction, semiconductors, and electronics to defense industries. I hold extensive certifications in quality management, enterprise risk management and business continuity, with a focus on operational excellence and team leadership across multi-cultural environments.
notes: Harting makes connectors, cables and PCBs, even 3D PCBs so on the higher tech side. 6000 FTEs, 1B, 14 prod plants. Thales has Paris HQ. 18B€ Electrical systems mfer. Hi tech, more assembly than low tier. Seems he was QA Manager for CH + HSE for all group

summary:
Multicultural manager, focused on results, within a car manufacturer and an automotive supplier:

● The management of international suppliers quality networks,
● Management of technological disruptions,
● The zero defect's expectation within the automotive industry mindset,
● The management of regulatory constraints with their local specificities.
notes: LEM only manufactures in Switzerland, 1800FTEs across 18 countries. Electrical measurement tech. Multiple plants would be a step up for him. Higher tier mfing exp. 16 yrs quality: -but 12 in Supplier Quality Strong process exp. at Renault

experience.title: Corporate Project Quality Manager
experience.description:
Manage the Project Quality teams worldwide, as a group function:
• Ensure, mainly in project development phase, that products are designed and manufactured according to the international standards, customer's requirements, and LEM's internal rules,
• Maintain & reinforce LEM quality culture with target of developing and manufacturing safer and more reliable products,
• Ensure integrity and respect of LEM's development framework, according to IPD (Integrated Product Development),
• Monitor and manage KPIs and ensure reporting and corrective actions wherever needed.
Hierarchically linked to the Quality VP

experience.title: Product Line Quality Director
experience.description:
Manage the Quality network for the Switch and Smart Controls (ISC) Product Line to achieve Customers Satisfaction for Quality:
• Organize, recruit the VALEO Site Quality teams and Projects Quality teams within the perimeter according to the objectives set by the Product Group and assess their performance,
• Monitor and Control the conformity on Development and Production processes,
• Deploy the Quality culture and develop the Quality Improvement Plan and tools to achieve the quality objectives and physical indicators,
• Lead the Customer interface for Quality matters (Quality in development, in production and after sales).
Hierarchically linked to the Product Line VP and functionally linked to the Product Group Quality Director.
experience.justification: This role involves managing the overall quality function at a divisional level, setting strategic direction, and achieving long-term quality objectives across multiple sites and projects.

experience.title: Product Groups SQA Director
experience.description:
Lead the global SQA network for the Intuitive Control (CIC) and Connected Cars (CCC) Product Groups to ensure the quality of the components in project and mass-production:
• Structure, recruit managers and commodity engineers by regions according to the objectives set by the Group SQA and assess their performance,
• Validate in partnership with the Purchasing function, suppliers within the panel committee,
• Ensure compliance with the quality standards of the Group SQA, including the strict application of the Supplier Quality Manual (SQM) and the AQP.pp deliverables.
Hierarchically linked to the Product Groups Quality Directors, the Business Group Purchasing VP and functionally linked to the Group SQA Director.
experience.justification: Leading a global SQA network across multiple product groups indicates a senior managerial role with strategic responsibilities, but not quite at the director level of the entire quality function.

experience.title: Body Shop Process Project Manager
experience.description:
Manage a team of Industrial Functional Pilots and functionally all employees contributing to the industrial system:
• Set up, organise and manage the body shop project team and overall system, this is done to ensure definition of processes, supply and tryout of industrial systems for compliance of QCTHR and industrial performance objectives.
• Co-manage relations with the interface body shop (product and process) and the Production Department of the production site.
Hierarchically linked to the Project Development General Manager and functionally linked to the Industrial Project Director
experience.justification: While not strictly a quality role, this position involves overseeing large teams and providing strategic input for industrial processes, which is comparable to a senior quality supervisor role in terms of responsibility and impact.

experience.title: Industrial Projects Manager
experience.description:
Coordinate all the industrial tasks required to start LCV vehicles on two assembly plants in order to achieve the objectives of the project:
• Involved in the design of the industrial plant's framework and coordinated all activities necessary for the industrialization of LCV vehicles in two plants (including planning, robustness of product / process for each milestone).
• Fulfill the industrial performance QCTHR (as stated in the joint contract between Engineering and Manufacturing as well as in the Monozukuri performance).
• Represent the voice of manufacturing during the project.
Hierarchically linked to the Director of Industrial Projects and functionally linked to the Chief Vehicle Engineer.
experience.justification: This role, while not directly in quality, involves coordinating activities that impact product quality. The level of responsibility is similar to a mid-level quality supervisor managing multiple teams or aspects of quality.

experience.title: Suppliers Quality Corporate Manager
experience.description:
Ensure the optimization of the modes of operation and of the organization of French and international Suppliers' Quality Assurance Dept. :
• Ensure the development and relevant implementation of audit benchmarks for evaluating suppliers,
• Pilot the project to mutualize the resources of all SQA Dpt.,
• Coordinate with purchasing and engineering Dept., common approaches for suppliers (in particular the quality assurance process (ANPQP) for the development of suppliers' parts).
experience.justification: This position involves managing the supplier quality function at a corporate level, implementing strategies, and achieving quality goals, which aligns with the responsibilities of a Quality Manager.

experience.title: Suppliers Quality Project Manager
experience.description:
Manage a team of Suppliers' Quality Engineers based on the objectives of the Laguna Coupé project:
• Create and manage the budget of the team (staff, running costs, trainings),
• Check the convergence for the validation of the quality assurance (ANPQP) of incoming parts for the vehicle in coherence with project milestones,
• Ensure and lead the implementation of progress action plans for all scopes of Suppliers' Quality Engineers.
experience.justification: Managing a team of Suppliers' Quality Engineers and overseeing quality assurance for a specific project aligns with the responsibilities of a mid-level quality supervisor.

experience.title: Production Manager
experience.description:
Lead an Elementary Work Unit and then a manufacturing workshop, in order to achieve the objectives (Quality, Cost, Deadlines, Human Resources and Environment):
• Guarantee operational standards and improvements of the mass production workshop,
• Get involved upstream of new projects (product-process) and of their implementation,
• Pilot the skills' improvement of co-workers by coaching, training and on-site support.
experience.justification: While this is a production role, it involves managing quality aspects in a manufacturing setting. The responsibilities are similar to those of a first-line quality supervisor in terms of overseeing daily operations and immediate problem-solving.

name: Piotr Naryński
summary: Experienced Head Of Quality Assurance with a demonstrated history of working in the automotive industry. Skilled in Quality Management, Kaizen, MES, Business Development, and Human Resources. Strong quality assurance professional with a Master of Business Administration (M.B.A.) Executive focused in Six Sigma based on study in Ronal Polska from Uniwersytet Ekonomiczny we Wrocławiu (daw. Akademia Ekonomiczna im. Oskara Langego we Wrocławiu. Many years of experience in production problem solving has also allowed me to develop skills in problem solving in quality and production areas. Participation in many projects such as building a new production plant in Poland from the ground up to produce the first wheel; Start-up of a new production plant in Mexico; Implementation of a product serialization project; Continuous improvement of production areas to meet all OEM customer requirements; Leading quality managers and production directors to reduce the scrap and rework rate; Looking for new innovations to automate processes; Selecting suppliers through proper selection to maintain quality for the manufactured product while reducing costs. Daily activities include support of production plants in the areas of quality and production with infrastructure. Monitoring of results and improvements and sharing of best practice between production sites.
notes: Ronal 6500 FTEs 1.3B€ 29 production plants overall. 2 greenfields Poland and Mexico. Size of Wheels product line? Largest

experience.title: Head of Group Quality
experience.description: Daily activities include support of production plants in the areas of quality and production with infrastructure. Continuous improvement of standardisation in both the system and production areas. Monitoring of results and improvements and sharing of best practice between production sites.
experience.justification: As Head of Group Quality, this role involves managing the overall quality function at an organizational level, responsible for strategic direction and achieving long-term quality objectives across multiple production sites.

experience.title: Senior Manager Group Quality
experience.description: Performing tasks assigned by the Quality Director. Support quality managers in the group by customer services. Project Manager by implementing solutions for improvement quality of produced product.
experience.justification: This position involves overseeing significant quality functions, developing strategies, and contributing to organizational planning by supporting quality managers across the group and managing improvement projects.

experience.title: Senior Quality Manager
experience.description: Responsible for the quality department (Incoming Inspection, X-Ray, Heat Treatment, Flow Forming, SPC, laboratory for surface tests and destructive-fatigue tests, outgoing inspection) and supporting production areas in solving production problems while maintaining KPIs.

name: Adam Wietrzyński
summary: >18 years experience in automotive by biggest Tier 1 players (Delphi Automotive, Mahle, GKN Driveline, Valeo & Forvia - Faurecia). Senior Manager positions for past 13 years in Automotive and Machining industry (Quality Manager/Director, Quality & Risk Director) with interactions and management with cross functional (Customers, Operations, Suppliers, R&D, Process, Warranty, Quality, HR, Finance), international teams, and multi-sites management experience. Team Leader on Quality Task Force to solve Quality Issues, both internal and with OEM Customers. 3,5 years experience in global leading consumer electronics provider - Dell Computers. Supplier Quality Manager for over 6 years (auditing various production processes at suppliers, developing suppliers, supporting suppliers in production transfer processes). Deep knowledge of the Automotive Quality Core Tools. Collaborating on different cross-functional levels with big OEM’s (Toyota, BMW, Daimler - Mercedes Benz, Porsche, Audi, VW, Skoda, Seat, Volvo, JLR, MAN, Scania, Renault, PSA, TPCA, Honda, GM, Opel, FCA). As Voice of the Customer, high engagement was the key to being successful. Proven KPI’s improvements: Customer PPM’s, # of Complaints, gaining Customer Quality Award. On Quality & Supplier Quality functions, strong influence and management of cross-functional teams - giving directions in remote environment not only into direct reports. Project member for 2 greenfield projects: Dell Computer (1,800 employees) and GKN Driveline (1,100 employees). Lean Six Sigma Green Belt certified (2007), Lean Six Sigma Black Belt (2024).
notes: Automotive suppliers, IATF 16949, but Tier 1 suppliers—more assembly, focus on final car parts less mfg. No specific data on IST employees (113 on LI) and revenue but in 2023 he was Head of Quality for a single Forvia plant with 130M T/O in Germany. Project member for 2 greenfield projects. Cross-functional teams.

experience.company: Innovative Sensor Technology IST AG (Endress & Hauser Group)
experience.description: Innovative Sensor Technology IST AG, a company of the global Endress + Hauser Group (16,000 employees), is a leading supplier of physical, chemical, and biological sensors. Responsibilities include overall responsibility for maintaining and further development of the Quality and Environment Management System of the whole IST Group. Organization and implementation of the audits by Certification company, customer, system, process and product audits. Organization of internal audits, evaluation, and initiation of improvement measures and projects together with different areas. Regular training courses on quality management and advice on QM issues.

With 266 industrial sites, 39 R&D centers, and about 150,000 employees in 35 countries, Faurecia is a top ten global automotive supplier. Faurecia’s mission is to develop technologies for Sustainable Mobility and to create personalized experiences for the Cockpit of the Future. Plant turnover in 2021 budgeted around 130 million euros. Responsibilities include reporting to the Plant Director and Operations Head of Quality Europe, acting as Voice of the Customer for Daimler Account, technical and disciplinary management of the quality department, lean activities (5S, Gemba Walk), complaint management, APQP and P-FMEA management, PDCA analyses, and cross-departmental initiatives for quality improvement and cost reduction.

Wiesheu stands for innovative products and solutions for professional oven users at the point of sale, underlining excellent customer service. Wiesheu GmbH is the operative management company with an additional production site in Bitterfeld-Wolfen, alongside sales and service companies in Poland, France, and the USA. The Wiesheu Group had a 2020 turnover of 125 million euros. Responsibilities include reporting to the CEO, technical and disciplinary management of the quality department, lean activities (5S, Gemba Walk), and anchoring quality awareness with the primary goal of reducing quality costs. Other duties involve developing the Wiesheu quality strategy, implementing quality concepts, ISO certifications, and planning internal/external audits.

Production of wiper systems, motors for windshield wipers, and front-end modules. 900 employees in Bietigheim-Bissingen and 1,200 employees across three locations. Responsibilities included managing a quality team of 35 employees, implementing and further developing the QM system in close cooperation with the Valeo Quality Network, ensuring customer quality standards, operational introduction of new QM standards, and risk identification and management.

Member of the board with responsibilities for managing a team of 35 employees across different quality-related departments. Managed customer complaints, led the APQP process, coordinated 5S workshops, and participated in a greenfield project to open a new plant. Turnover of approximately 350 million euros.

Managed quality for cylinder liners, valves, and valve guides with a team of 40 employees. Responsibilities included managing customer complaints, leading APQP processes, overseeing corrective actions post-audit, and supporting production with daily quality challenges. Collaboration with German headquarters on strategic projects.

experience.title: EMEA Customer Operations Manager
experience.description: Managed relationships with retailers and logistic partners, ensuring customer satisfaction from order receipt to product delivery. Key activities included supply chain management and handling product launches.
experience.justification: While not strictly a quality role, this position involved managing customer satisfaction and supply chain, which are closely related to quality management.

experience.title: Supplier Quality Engineer Supply Chain Europe
experience.description: Managed supplier quality for product lines of laptops, desktops, and servers. Conducted supplier audits and led Six Sigma projects, achieving Green Belt certification.
experience.justification: Managed supplier quality for multiple product lines and conducted supplier audits, indicating a mid-level professional role.

experience.title: Supplier Quality Engineer
experience.description: Managed supplier quality for heat exchangers and HVAC modules. Oversaw supplier audits and handled corrective actions. Key clients included VW, Porsche, Opel.
experience.justification: Managed supplier quality for specific products and conducted supplier audits, typical of a mid-level quality professional role.

experience.title: Manufacturing Engineer
experience.description: Developed instructions for production lines and designed packaging for HVAC projects with clients such as VW and Porsche. Supported sales teams in customer negotiations.
experience.justification: While not a direct quality role, this position involved developing production instructions and supporting quality-related activities, similar to an experienced quality control specialist.

name: Hamilton P.
summary: Experienced in the implementation and sustainability of product Quality, production Quality, and Quality Management Systems, successfully targeting customer satisfaction in all aspects of production, supply chain, and launching of new products. Skilled in the Automotive Industry cluster, recognizing and exercising the value of collaboration to improve Quality between the OEM and Suppliers (Tier1 and Tier2), under respect of international and specific automotive norms and standards. A mentor capable of taking decisions with self-assertion, autonomy, and proactive use of Quality management techniques and tools for problem-solving and process improvement. Green-Field experienced, deploying to corporations international standard procedures, defining and establishing should-be conditions for new sites, and launching products without stopping any customer's production line. Certified Licensed Third-party Lead auditor for international standards: IATF 16949:2016, ISO 45001:2018, ISO 14001:2015, and ISO 9001:2015. Certified ISO/IEC 27001 Information Security Officer & ISMS Auditor with knowledge of TISAX for readiness assessments. Certified VDA 6.3:2023 Process Auditor (1st/2nd Party).
notes: Strong v. relevant Quality track (including Change Mgmt and Auditing) until 2017. Johnson, VW, auto suppliers. Surprising turn in last position that tracks well with his previous so he might have changed course away from us.

experience.description: Responsible for corporate internal Information Security and TISAX Audits, external 2nd Party VDA 6.3 Process Audits, and IATF internal corporate audits. thyssenkrupp Presta AG has approximately 10,900 employees worldwide across 24 plants and development facilities. The company develops steering systems for over 30 million vehicles per year and is focused on trends like autonomous driving and powertrain electrification.

experience.company: SQS - Swiss Association for Quality and Management Systems
experience.description: Conducted national and international audits ensuring compliance with ISO 9001:2015, ISO 14001:2015, ISO 45001:2018, and IATF 16949 standards. Tasks included initial certification, surveillance, and re-certification audits under ISO 17021-1:2015 and IAF regulations.

experience.title: Quality & Reliability Europe – EU Manufacturing Footprint Dev.
experience.description: Led the quality assurance development for new European manufacturing sites, including budget planning, resource allocation, and production readiness. Successfully obtained ISO management certifications for new sites.

experience.title: Customer Quality Manager - Automotive
experience.description: Ensured customer satisfaction by coordinating quality assurance measures between Johnson Electric and its customers, handling complaints, and executing audits for continuous improvement programs.
experience.justification: Managed customer quality in the automotive sector, coordinating between the company and customers, typical of a quality manager role.

experience.description: Key contact for all quality matters between VW-Individual in Wolfsburg and VW Autoeuropa in Portugal for the Scirocco R project. Coordinated the introduction of specific content into serial production and validated engineering changes before SOP.

Coordinated technical changes for the 5-segmented Hard Top Cabrio Roof for the Volkswagen EOS. Responsibilities included feasibility studies, cost optimization, and release of changes in the production process.

Responsible for ensuring supplier production readiness and quality standards for the 5-segmented Hard Top Cabrio Roof on the VW EOS project. Managed supplier audits, process validation, and part submission.

experience.company: MAGNA STEYR Fahrzeugtechnik AG & Co KG
experience.description: Coordinated interior product development and technical changes for the BMW X3 pre-series vehicles. Worked closely with engineering and purchasing teams to ensure launch readiness.
Key contact between SEAT R&D in Spain and VW Autoeuropa in Portugal, responsible for coordinating the introduction of specific facelift content for the SEAT Alhambra into serial production.
Coordinated product development for interior components, including dashboards, HVAC, and seats, for the VW Sharan, SEAT Alhambra, and FORD Galaxy pre-series vehicles.

name: Justyna Potęga
notes: Oerlikon makes Surface Solutions and Polymer Processing Solutions. It has a global footprint of more than 12,600 employees at 207 locations in 38 countries and generated sales of CHF 2.7 billion in 2023. Most of experience in higher tier suppliers, some aerospace, some low tier electronics (TE Connectivity) + Oerlikon (low tier).

experience.description: Projects: Bepi Colombo, Ariane 5 payload, Atlas payload

name: Luiz Benacchio
summary: Dynamic senior leader in plant management, manufacturing, and operations. Overall 27 years of professional experience (8 years in South America, 12 years in Europe and 7 years in Asia), including short term assignments in Mexico, Romania, and China. MBA-educated with a sound foundation in business principles and senior leadership. Outstanding history of success in performance and operations management. Dedicated to optimizing manufacturing and engineering operations via lean principles. Well-versed in multinational and global management principles. Proven champion of cultural transformation, focused on quality assurance and operations. Demonstrated track record of elevating service delivery standards and customer satisfaction. Adept at uniting multinational teams behind corporate vision and empowering success. Renowned for identifying and pursuing lucrative new business opportunities.
notes: ENERSYS EMEA - FR 800, UK 500, CZ 140, PL 850 so around 2300 FTEs. ENERSYS APAC - AUS 75, INDO - 40, CHINA - 500. 9 plants overall. Around 2900 FTEs total so good size match. Enersys 3.6B$. No regional breakdown. Energy systems, from low to high tier. IATF 16949. Customer focus, cross-functional.

experience.justification: Responsible for global supplier quality strategy, indicating a senior role with significant influence across multiple regions.

experience.title: EMEA & APAC and Global Advanced Quality Senior Director
experience.description: Added responsibility for APAC region and New Product Development (APQP). Achieved IATF 16949 certification in two factories in France and UK, and improved customer quality KPIs, reducing warranty costs by 50% and supplier rejection rate by 70%.
experience.justification: Expanded responsibilities across regions and new product development, with significant improvements in quality KPIs.

experience.description: Managed a team of 30 professionals, deployed automotive-quality methodologies, achieved certification of Integrated Management System (ISO 9001, 14001, 18001), and improved supplier quality performance.

experience.description: Transformed a 37-member quality team, implemented FMEA using TDC software, and facilitated a corporate move to a new plant.
